title: Toxicity is still a huge deciding factor in games, btw
body:
Posting this as a reminder that if the rager/leaver isn't on your team, they're probably on the other team.

Also posting this as a reminder that the only people who are immediately punished by toxicity are the people who are just trying to play the game.

Lastly, posting this as a reminder that Riot punishes you choosing to not start a game with a troll/rager and encourages you to go out of your way to type up a support ticket and wait in a long queue to be acknowledged while that same person gets to continue to ruin games for other people.

______

Funny enough, right after I posted this thread and queued up for another game, I was matched against a bot that just ran down mid repeatedly.

http://puu.sh/iwC5J/d41e8a0947.png

I'm really sad I can't find the tribunal anymore. Seemed like it helped a lot and I spent a long time on it. Seems like no one has been banned in a long time for toxicity and the reports don't do much.

EDIT: Hunted down the tribunal and it says it is in maintenance... How long I wonder...

You missed the announcement. They now automatically ban people for toxicity, no human overview. They just started doing it recently, so for the past 8-9 months there have been little to no bans, but now people are getting banned en masse.

That's exactly why we need the tribunial back, we need living breathing intellegent humans to decide who gets punished/banned. Building more complex robots cost money, humans, in this case the community, are free and actually can comphrend and vote if they deserve bad or good. The human emotion itself is only understandable by humans and never understood by bots.

Other people have a right to play,even if they're not up to your vaunted standards friend.

When you get hostile to them,you broke the Code, and are punished for it (eventually) - **as you should be**

You can choose to curse the poor sod a new poop-chute in the privacy of your gaming area, but when you put fingers to keyboard, you're past the reach of your own nose, so to speak.

No pity for ragers!
So you actually defend intentional feeders? Interesting. This right here is the problem with the community, and why it has gotten worse.

Just one warning, then the banhammer. No matter how justified they thought they were in their raging.

Ban 1 rager and the troll is going to cause another to rage. Will never end. If you ban them all, you will be playing League alone. Bottom line is this: the current way they are going about it is clearly unintelligent and you will be back bitching next year about the same thing. If you don't actually want to take steps to fix the problem, that is fine. Don't, however, bitch about the problem if you don't want it fixed. Have a jolly day in fairly land guy. I won't be responding to your nonsense anymore.

I just pointed out that you're an idiot if you don't understand people raging in the first place is a major contributing factor when people do stuff like afk and intentionally feed, although it clearly went over your head.

The title is that toxicity still plays a major role in games.  It clearly does.  You can justify being an ass all you want, hope it works out for you.

Well, in order for it to work for me, I'd have to do it in the first place xD. Anyway, people intentionally feed and afk long before anyone is "toxic" to them. If what they think is verbal abuse really bothers them, they could simply mute and move on with their game. So no, people raging doesn't play a factor into someone intentionally feeding. That person already decided they were going to screw over 4 teammates. If they hadn't, they would just mute someone that bitches. I've seen way more feeders and trolls than I have people that rage for no reason.

Regardless, I can come back and bump this in a years time. I bet that League will be just as, if not more, toxic than it is now. Reason being is that they way they are going about fixing it is completely backwards. But that doesn't matter. But I think people should stop bitching about League "toxicity" if they don't want to make an honest attempt to fix it.

Ooor.. mute your rage, say it out loud to yourself (providing no mic is involved).

Deliberate feeders are scum. But raging at them makes your team tilt, annoys your teammates, and drags you to their level - all the while doing nothing productive.

Case #1: "FUCKING FEEDER!" _is_ a troll. Your rage is what they want. You're encouraging them. 

Case #2: "FUCKING FEEDER!" is only a feeder in your estimation. They may be new. They may be having  a bad day. Maybe, maybe they really are just plain bad. Being a dick won't make them play any better.

Raging is never acceptable. In no circumstances does raging solve anything. If you can't play the game without raging _at someone_ -- i.e.you can't just groan to yourself and curse their name under your breath,even scream it into your monitor (again,provided there's no mic involved) - you're not venting frustration - you're wanting to hurt someone else, and _you_ are as bad as they are in RIot's eyes - probably worse!

Riot has made this plain. If you can't live with that, don't complain when they ban you from the game or otherwise punish you.

Sorry to burn that strawman before you could argue with it, pard.

Your focus on my raging is completely false. You probably shouldn't use such accusations as a point in your comment.

You did hit the nail on the head, though, when you said raging at deliberate feeders. It seems like common sense that if you cut out the deliberate feeder, you would cut out the person raging at them, and the future people they would cause to do it.

Nope, sorry, nice failed attempt at redirecting, friend. 

My focus is on raging because raging *is* the problem. And if you can't accept that, that's not the problem of the people who want to play the game as Riot wants it played - without raging.
I said, "focus on MY raging". Because that is false. I didn't say focused on raging in general. I guess they don't teach teenagers like they used to.

being toxic is a choice.

And there is no excuse for that.
I am also from time to time mildly toxic but I have only myself to blame for that.
You get cancer if you hold it in, which is why we need to make lol ribbons for the millions getting cancer by being polite and hold it in.

He also said that toxic players see more toxicity in their games. Sure you're not causing negative reactions?

Picking champions someone doesn't like for some reason?  Not saying anything when you get flamed?  Asking someone to stop flaming?  Dying once in lane?  Not magically preventing someone from dying to a gank because they were overextended without wards?

No different then our jails/prisons in irl. Let's put a bunch of bad people in one place, everyone will get better and it will fix everything.

It's not a part of the system...Toxic players make other people toxic via retaliation. When you start being verbally abusive to someone, they're 9 times out of 10 going to react in some negative way. Verbally abusing you or someone else on their team, intentionally feeding, spamming forfeits, etc.

secondly, you **are** punished for choosing not to start a game that has a rager/troll in it. i'm referring to champion select where, if you "dodge" by closing out the client, you are forced to wait a certain amount of time before you're allowed to join a queue. this time scales with frequency. in ranked, your next win will result in -3 to your total LP gains. if you're in a promotional series, it counts as a loss. if you want the actions of that troll/rager to be noticed by someone at riot, you have to send in a support ticket. this is extremely common knowledge and the fact that you're suggesting that i'm trying to "kick some dirt into the wind" shows that you're the one who doesn't know how the system works
